documents.document: Following up one desert island disc with another https://t.co/xplW8onjTh
Listening to one of the best albums ever created. The perfect way to finish the week. https://t.co/KSpodh9gz4
@PeopleofNZ One of my desert island discs
@PeopleofNZ Listening to records is the best way to spend a Friday evening https://t.co/E65ebljOCC
@beerlyted That's a given. Always.
@beechworks He is my hero
One of the best benefits of having an ex-leaky home is the air conditioner we had installed ☀️❄️❄️
@beechworks Does Fluffy Jim always comply? He strikes me as a bit of a non-conformist.
@beechworks They’re so orderly.
Someone needs to make a version of that new Nickelback vid with Rick Astley audio. People already think it’s a trap; may as well make it one
@spacekatgal He really is making America safe again, huh? The rest of the world is shaking our heads in utter disbelief & confusion :-(
A reality TV star as POTUS, a Nickelback song that doesn’t totally suck. These really are strange times indeed https://t.co/NMJUGuJEFf
Time to step back from hard and heavy #VinylFriday https://t.co/AZSjGFg0vO
@davejac I have all their albums on CD, so I’m sorted there :-)
So it seems Siri can't translate the voice of the Anciients https://t.co/9TJKyVPJpJ
@paulbrislen When we returned from Australia in 2004, we were surprised to find it was no longer widely taught. Was a staple back in our day
@davejac In fact, Right in Two seems quote apropos these days.
@davejac This seems like a perfectly acceptable workplace activity. Some may even say it should be compulsory.
It seems #VinylFriday is definitely trending towards hard and heavy today. Must be taking cues from Twitter. https://t.co/lxJ4qHkxXC
If I’m gonna have a late start to #VinylFriday, I may as well start off with a bang https://t.co/sTYjQLYlJF
Got excited to see this end up in my inbox. But it’s a non-localised email, with only European dates :-( https://t.co/4wXZ4rNuCe
Anyone go to @OfficialOpeth at the Powerstation last night? How was it?
@barristernz I hope he doesn’t have a taste for kiwifruit. Note sure we’d repel a US invasion for long.
The real Trump/Turnbull beef is over the ’81 underarm bowling incident. But the US media don’t understand cricket so they took another angle
@stephentotilo Boycott Outback Steakhouse!

Hey @pmbillenglish, don’t forget to ask who won the popular vote when he calls… Do it for our Aussie mates
https://t.co/qogMkkWtGA
@peopleofnz Apparently we’re the Plan B for US billionaires https://t.co/ojsQWoeFnK

I thought “This has to be satire.”. But apparently not…
https://t.co/Brf8JdV2CW https://t.co/KPkqtToiqs
@peopleofnz My goal is to be able to play a song at my 50th (I turn 45 next week). Can muddle through a couple, but by play I mean shred :-)
@peopleofnz Very early days. Got a lesson tonight actually. Chord changes are a bit problematic ATM. :-)
@peopleofnz Get good enough on guitar that I’m happy to post a YouTube video of me playing.
Is this what you really stand for, @nzlabour? You traditionally get my vote, but non-evidence based fear mongering… https://t.co/hz44NLevot
@kiwipom Too late :-)
@kiwipom Crikey! Thanks for the reminder. Better get my purchase underway. Stat!
@peopleofnz I know. I contract to a US company, and spend all day Skyping US mates. So it’s hard just pressing the mute button :-(
@yakmoose @xenojay As cunning as a fox who's just been appointed Professor of Cunning at Oxford University
@xenojay @yakmoose …and a large bucket of manure
@yakmoose @xenojay Is she on Twitter? I have a plan…
@peopleofnz And food tweets. But they’re OK. Provided they’re gluten-free :-)
@peopleofnz I remember when Twitter used to be about fun and winning crap. Now its all politics and fighting.
@xenojay Yeah, but for them to not elect Trump would’ve been unpresidented, so I’m not surprised that didn’t happen.
Kia kaha, USA. I still have hope that your constitutional safeguards are strong enough to pull you through this.
Tempted to tweet that Michael Jackson popcorn GIF to describe how the world is viewing the US right now, but I don’t think anyone’s smiling
@manginimike Please tell me this includes New Zealand
The best tech review I’ve read in a long time https://t.co/vaCTPGrbbt
@littlecatdesign I’ve changed tack to stop personal attacks on “He who shall not be named”, & instead encourage our leaders to speak for us
@littlecatdesign Especially considering the US has the concept of a Denied Persons List https://t.co/6XAVvfc4j8
@littlecatdesign It makes speaking out against such a thin skinned and vindictive “leader” not as cut and dry as it should be :-(
@littlecatdesign Not sure if I missed that one or not, but FWLIW I’m 100% tied to the USA for my income.
@wilw We have a beagle with traits eerily similar to those exhibited here.

@spacekatgal The Porsche, of course. The correct answer is always Porsche.
(Disclaimer: Porsche junkie (but not yet owner) here)
@peopleofnz Thats one of my favourite ads. I’ve since made it my ongoing mission to do things more Piratey.
I’ve reached out to my local MP, @PhilTwyford, and he is always responsive. But it’d be great to talk to also someone with the PMs ear.
Are there any @NZNationalParty MPs that actually interact with constituents on Twitter? @pmbillenglish seems to be a 1 way advertorial a/c.
@peopleofnz Spotify works well for us with the family sub. Has my prog metal/rock, my wife’s pop, & whatever crap our teens listen to
@peopleofnz Problem is, it gets quite expensive. The stuff I gravitate to isn’t always readily available locally, & can be pricy to import
@peopleofnz Yep. And @SpotifyNZ’s weekly playlist seems to nail it for me. Discovered so many artists that way.
@peopleofnz I love how streaming music services excel at finding new music, so I can bolster my vinyl collection with new (to me) bands
Currently in mourning. Finished S3 of The Bridge on @LightboxNZ last night. Gonna miss spending time with Saga & friends.
@aaronpinkham They’re almost as spiffy as my socks https://t.co/o2D4EdpgQ0
PSA: The correct twitter handle for our PM is @pmbillenglish and not @BillEnglishMP. This caught me out, and I’m seeing others are too
Home made pasta exceeded expectations. Chur @mildchillimama https://t.co/QHCRQ1ehxc
Home made gluten-free pasta for tea tonight. So not all is broken in the world. https://t.co/1AXr5jjAsb
(This time with correct PM handle) #rtp
@Pseudony_Ms <BLUSH> Thanks for the heads up
@tcs0 It's ok. Only 2.0 sound though.
@tcs0 Starting from the first season.
It turns out that rewatching The West Wing is the perfect antidote to watching the Trump administration.
@PhilTwyford @BillEnglishMP Thank you
.@PhilTwyford and getting New Zealand to accept those refugees turned away from the USA would be choice too
Hey @PhilTwyford, as my local MP could you please apply pressure to @BillEnglishMP to ensure New Zealand condemns #MuslimBan ?
C'mon @BillEnglishMP, let's show the current US administration how to lead with compassion and humanity. https://t.co/LcZ02ufu72
Bacon acquired and consumed. Time to activate Sunday phase II https://t.co/JaPV4lF55a
Hey @BillEnglishMP, time to step up where other world leaders won't. https://t.co/LmISk6UWVI
@LittleCatDesign My income is 100% tied to the US. So the new administration's isolationist policies are of serious concern.
@pcuser42 Been there, done that, got the t-shirt
@stuold That was a very expensive crate of beer.
@nytimes @danny_thorpe @BeauWillimon has a call to action to help educate him on this one https://t.co/yxXLlaBNUy
What the US Can Learn From Canada's Battle With an Anti-Science Government https://t.co/rEoISlm520 via @gizmodo
@elpie 😂 Love it! A little white lie about a little white vegetable.
@paulbrislen @elpie Was there confirmation that the original one was legit?
@elpie @lauriefleming @toby_etc “Eww! What’s this green crap?” my nephew says. “Wheres the guacamole? The red stuff”. He meant salsa 3/3
@elpie @lauriefleming @toby_etc “Will there be guacamole?” he asked. “I love guacamole”. My wife make the best damn guac ever. 2/3
@elpie @lauriefleming @toby_etc I’ve got a funny guacamole story. Had a nephew staying with us. We were having tacos for dinner. 1/3
Discovered these guys at last years @musicinparks. Perfect if you need more 70s style rock in your life https://t.co/P1LIGAIDIh #nowplaying
@ctrevettnzh @annagconnell Except they’ll refer to it as the Connell President.

Looks like Stephen Bannon will be getting a bit of “fan” mail, thanks to @BeauWillimon. Well played
https://t.co/yxXLlaBNUy
We need to fix this 😢 https://t.co/iH8lyzR1wg
Peach iced tea or beer? Not quite sure 🤔 https://t.co/jbSIaMWtfA
@cateowen @chrisphilpottnz It did NOT put us in the right frame of mind to be spending the day with lawyers :-(
@cateowen @chrisphilpottnz Speaking of TWW, we attended our first leaky home mediation after watching the ep where Leo had his heart attack
@cateowen @chrisphilpottnz Especially fun if you’re a fan of Rob Sitch and the Working Dog Production team’s work.
@cateowen @chrisphilpottnz Another politically themed show you may enjoy, is Utopia on Netflix (a comedy about bureaucracy).
@cateowen Watching The West Wing under that guise seems really nice right about now.
So a 20% tax on Mexican imports. Any vinyl pressing plants down there? Imagine if US Pink Floyd buyers are just another brick in the Wall.
@samjarman Thought that may be the case :-)
@samjarman It’s a trusty old workhorse, only being shunned because he’s been superseded by an iPhone 7
@samjarman 10.something
I know the seller. He’s a stand up guy. 👍 https://t.co/NG5oVI0h0p
@elpie But the initial signs from the first few days of the Trump administration aren’t doing much to alleviate these fears.
